bug.author: everling
bug.summary: Plotly broken in wide mode on 0.53
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Plotly graphs fail to extend in width and fill the screen in "wide mode" in 0.53. Works in 0.52.2. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Minimal streamlit app: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import cufflinks fig = cufflinks.datagen.lines().iplot(asFigure=True) st.write(fig) </denchmark-code>
Check 'wide mode' in settings. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.53 Python version: 3.5.4 Plotly version: 4.4.1 Cufflinks version: 0.17.2 OS version: Windows 10 as well as Debian-based docker image

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/everling>@everling</denchmark-link> , You have to pass use_container_width=True to the chart. Also this parameter isn't supported by st.write so you have to use st.plotly_chart. Please try the following.. <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import cufflinks fig = cufflinks.datagen.lines().iplot(asFigure=True) st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True) </denchmark-code>
